Chair Burr on introducing Secretary Condos: "Jim, thanks for bringing this weather here with you today." ‚ùÑÔ∏è

Hey #vtpoli - tune in now to catch Secretary Condos testifying before the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence regarding election cyber security, and the need for funding to help states protect our elections from foreign interference in 2018 and beyond. https://t.co/cIS4aetAEy
The second panel, which includes Secretary Condos, will begin shortly after a brief recess. If you missed the link to live stream here it is again: https://t.co/cIS4aetAEy

Protecting the integrity of our elections from cyber-attacks & foreign interference is not a partisan issue, & we appreciate the Committee's bipartisan reccos that states use auditable paper ballots, & that Congress release funds to help states upgrade election infrastructure.

Securing our elections from interference is a TOP priority of ours.

Well in advance of the 2016 elections we conducted a thorough cyber security risk assessment & penetration testing of our elections systems.  Since then we have continued with constant monitoring/evaluation.

An unfortunate bi-product of increased election system targeting by Russia & other hackers is a loss of voter confidence in the integrity of our elections.

That's why it's so critical that states receive the funding, info & intel that we need to ensure our systems are secure.

See our full press release on the appearance of Secretary Condos before the Senate Select Intelligence Committee as President-elect of @NASSorg to testify on election cyber security: https://t.co/D6ctKUXyHR https://t.co/lrcOqm8lZx

We know the threat of meddling from Russia & other foreign entities in our elections is not over.

To prepare for the November General Election & beyond, states need Congressional support & the release of funding to ensure our election systems are protected from cyber-attacks.

State election officials are on the front lines protecting our elections from meddling and foreign interference.

We continue to work with our federal partners at DHS to increase communications and information sharing, and we need this commitment to continue.

The hearing has started with opening remarks from Committee Chair Senator Burr and Vice Chair Senator Warner. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Secretary Nielson is up next, followed by former DHS Secretary Johnson. https://t.co/BPUa0b6A0N
